products.name: 15ml Organically Grown Basil
products.description:
Country of Origin: India, Oranically Grown

Botanical Name: Ocimum basilicum

Plant Part: Leaf 

Note: Sweet, Warm, Spicy, and Herbal.


Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Basil has been used to assist in:

  • Antibacterial: antimicrobial reduction of bacteria from kitchens and bathrooms, preventing contamination and purifying the air
  • Antiviral: Immune stimulant and kills viruses
  • Cold and Flu: detoxifying the body of bacteria and viruses
  • Muscle Pain: fighting inflammation, pain, and fatigue
  • Ear: naturally calming an ear infection while reducing pain and swelling, by application behind the ear
  • Dental: removing bacteria and odor from the mouth and protect teeth from aches, ulcers, sores and viral blisters
  • Energy/Mood: restore mental alertness and fight fatigue
  • Insects: repel mosquitoes and prevent minor bug bites
  • Urinary: diuretic, detoxifying the urinary and digestive tracts
  • Acne: reduce skin break outs by fighting against built-up bacteria
  • Digestion: assists increasing the production of urine thus reducing water retention, uncomfortable bloating and digestive issues
  • Stress: relaxing and unwinding


Extraction Method: Steam Distillation


Historic Benefits: Basil was first put to cultivate in India where it is pretty common to plant to check the soil. The term basil is derived from the Greek word Basilikos meaning “herb worthy of a king.”


Blends Well With: Black Cumin, Cedarwood, Citrus Oils, Lavender, Myrrh, Roman Chamomile, Rosewood,

Patchouli, Sandalwood, Ylang Ylang


Precautions: Use sparingly during pregnancy.

products.name: 15ml Organically Grown Bergamot
products.description:

Botanical Name: Citrus bergamia

Plant Part: Peel

Note: Classic Citrus Tangy-Green Top Note



Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Bergamot has been used to assist in:

  • Depression: uplifting and reduces nervous tension 
  • Uplifting: creating a feeling of joy and freshness
  • Energy: by improving blood circulation
  • Metabolism: enabling proper digestions of nutrients in the digestive system
  • Infection: inhibition of the growth of germs, fungi and viruses
  • Pain: lessens pain nerve sensitivity thus reducing the symptoms of sprains, muscle aches, and headaches
  • Skin: evens the supply of melanin minimizing the look of scars, acne and skin irritations
  • Body Odor: reduce the growth of body odor germs and freshening the air
  • Fever: fights infections cause by harmful bacteria (topically)
  • Cavity: removing germs from teeth and protecting from developing cavities

  • Congestion: battling a cold or cough and loosening phlegm and mucus


Extraction Method: Cold Pressed


Historic Benefits: Bergamot can be traced back to Southeast Asia and was named after the city of Bergamo in Lombardy, Italy, where it was originally sold. Bergamot oil is antibacterial, anti-infectious, anti-inflammatory and antispasmodic. 


Blends Well With: Cinnamon Bark, Grapefruit, Lemon, Mandarin, Orange, Sandalwood, Vanilla


Precautions: Photo Toxic so it can leave skin red, burnt, or blistered when exposed to the sun.

Historically this oil is known to assist with:

Country of Origin: England, Organic

Botanical Name: Anthemis nobilis

Plant Part: Plant and Flower

Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Roman Chamomile has been used to assist in:

  • Sedative: is found to be effective in calming, relaxing, assist emotional extremes particularly in small children, and a nightmare remedy

Extraction Method: Steam Distillation


Historic Benefits: Roman Chamomile is one of the oldest known medicinal herbs. The Egyptians dedicated chamomile to their sun god Ra because its flower reminded them of the sun. It was used by them as a cure for malaria and a part of the mummification process. The Romans liked to add it to their bath water and use it medicinally.


Blends Well With: Bergamot, Clary Sage, Geranium, Jasmine, Lavender, Rose, Ylang Ylang


Precautions: Do not use if allergic to the ragweed family.

products.name: 15ml Organic Cinnamon Bark
products.description:
Country of Origin: Madagascar, Organic

Botanical Name: Cinnamomum zeylanicum

Plant Part: Bark

Note: Warm Dry Sweet Herbal Spice



Man Found Standing, Medicine Man Practitioner writes: For greater details, see the picture printout from my book. Historically Cinnamon Bark has been used to assist in:

  • Antibacterial, Antiviral, Antifungal: kills fungus, viruses, and bacteria
  • Antimicrobial: reduces the growth of various microbes including bacteria, molds, fungi, dermatophytes, and so forth
  • Anti-Parasitic: kills parasites naturally
  • Anti-infectious: fights infections
  • Immune Stimulant: boosts the immune system
  • Antiseptic: effectively kills facial bacteria
  • Antidepressant: Assists to combat anxiousness, stress, and anger to bring clearing and peace
  • ﻿Antioxidant: reduces free radical damage and slows the aging process. It is ranked #7 by OTAC of all foods, spices and herbs across the world with the most concentration of antioxidants.


Extraction Method: Steam Distillation


Historic Benefits: The Arabs created limited supply of Cinnamon. They kept their trade routes difficult and their source a secret. This maintained a high price and made it a status symbol during the Middle Ages. It was sought after to inhibit the growth of bacteria, on meat and also to mask the smell and taste. European explorers claimed to have found its source in the New World. The Portuguese eventually found it in present day Sri Lanka. It is said that cinnamon has been used in perfumery for thousands of years and that Queen of Sheba used cinnamon in her seduction of King Solomon. 


Blends Well With: Cassia, Clove, Frankincense, Lavender, Lemon, Oregano, Orange, Patchouli, Rosemary, Thyme, Ylang Ylang


Precautions: Cinnamon is extremely hot and direct contact will burn the skin. Use with a carrier oil and with caution.
